terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and prevent conflicts
A software system designed to create, organize, store, and manage technical documentation and knowledge resources
A single, unified storage location where all documents, data, and resources are organized and accessible to authorized users
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on, edit, and comment on documents with instant updates visible to all participants
Isolated collections of data that are stored separately and not easily accessible to other departments or systems within an organization
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention, improving efficiency and reducing errors
Software and data storage that operates on remote servers accessed via the internet rather than on local computers or servers
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents or information from a storage system or database
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, requiring shared access to documentation
A systematic approach to monitoring and ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements and industry standards through documentation
The preservation and transfer of institutional knowledge and expertise within an organization through structured documentation
A chronological record of document changes, access, and modifications that provides accountability and compliance verification
A document storage system that allows users to quickly find specific information using keywords, tags, or filters
